metadata.title: CVE-2020-2752 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: CAPI). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior, 5.7.27 andprior and 8.0.17 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Client. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 5.3 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.28-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
